text_raw:

(1) 

These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing

(2) These Regulations and the Principal Regulations shall be construed 

together.

heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic 

(Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006).

title: conferred on him by sections 5(1) and 42 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24
heading: 3. Where a learner permit granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the
text_raw:
3. Where a learner permit granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the 

Principal Regulations expires during the period - 

(a) beginning on 1 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020, the 
learner permit shall be deemed to have been granted for an 
additional period of 8 months and the date of expiry shall be 8 
months after the expiry date specified on the permit, or 

(b) beginning on 1 July 2020 and ending on 31 October 2020, the 
learner permit shall be deemed to have been granted for an 
additional period of 4 months and the date of expiry shall be 4 
months after the expiry date specified on the permit.

title: conferred on him by sections 5(1) and 42 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24
heading: 4. Where a learner permit, granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of
text_raw:
4. Where a learner permit, granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of 
the Principal Regulations, is a permit to drive vehicles of more than one 
category and an expiry date, by category, occurs during the period - 

(a) beginning on 1 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020, the 
learner permit in respect of the category concerned shall be 
deemed to have been granted for an additional period of 8 
months and its period of validity shall be extended by 8 months, 
or 

(b) beginning on 1 July 2020 and ending on 31 October 2020, the 
learner permit in respect of the category concerned shall be 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 deemed to have been granted for an additional period of 4 
months and its period of validity shall be extended by 4 months.

text_raw:
5. The Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) (Amendment) (No. 2)

title: conferred on him by sections 5(1) and 42 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations expand the extension of validity of learner permits provided 
for by the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) (Amendment) (No. 2) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. 125 of 2020), which were brought in as a result of the 
Covid-19 pandemic. 

A learner permit that expired during the period beginning on 1 March 2020 and 
ending on 30 June 2020 has now been extended for a further 4 months from the 
original 4 month extension provided. The learner permit extension shall now be 
deemed to have been granted for a period of 8 months and the date of expiry 
shall be 8 months after the expiry date specified on the permit. 

Learner permits that are due to expire during the period beginning on 1 July 
2020 and ending on 31 October 2020 will now be extended for an additional 4 
months. The date of expiry for these permits shall be 4 months after the expiry 
date specified on the permit. 

The above extensions apply to all the categories listed on the learner permit 
from the date of expiry for each category.
